Acute adrenal insufficiency is ''a vital pathology, an extreme emergency''.

Treatment is started as soon as the diagnosis is suspected, even without diagnostic certainty. Hormone levels (cortisol, ACTH) can be measured at a later stage if they are not taken just before emergency treatment. They should not delay treatment.

question.title: What is the priority when starting treatment for acute adrenal insufficiency?

option_a.title: Delay treatment until hormone levels are confirmed

option_b.title: Start treatment as soon as possible, even without diagnostic certainty

option_c.title: Wait for a second opinion before starting treatment

option_d.title: Administer treatment only if the patient has a confirmed diagnosis

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
